sections.heading: Who Can Open
points: Single adult
Two adults only (Joint A or Joint B)
Guardian on behalf of minor
Guardian on behalf of person of unsound mind
Minor above 10 years in own name
Only one account can be opened by an individual as a single account
Only one account can be opened in the name of minor/above 10 years of age (self)/person of unsound mind
In case of death of a Joint holder, the surviving holder will be the sole holder...
Conversion of single to joint account or vice versa is not allowed
Nomination is mandatory at the time of opening of account
Minor after attaining majority has to submit fresh account opening form and KYC documents

sections.heading: Deposit and Withdrawal
points: All transactions must be in whole rupees
Minimum deposit: Rs. 500 (subsequent min: Rs. 10)
Minimum withdrawal: Rs. 50
No maximum deposit limit
Withdrawal not allowed if it reduces balance below Rs. 500
Rs. 50 maintenance fee if balance not raised to Rs. 500 by year end
Account closes automatically if balance becomes Nil

sections.heading: Interest
points: Calculated on minimum balance between 10th and end of month
No interest if balance < Rs. 500 between 10th and end of month
Credited at end of financial year
Paid up to preceding month at closure
Interest up to Rs. 10,000 exempt under Section 80TTA

sections.heading: Silent Account
points: No transaction for 3 years makes account dormant
Revival requires application, fresh KYC and passbook

sections.heading: Additional Facilities
points: Cheque book
ATM Card
eBanking/Mobile Banking
Aadhaar Seeding
Atal Pension Yojana (APY)
PMSBY
PMJJBY

sections.heading: Notes
points: Post Office Savings Account Rules 2019
Government Savings Promotion General Rules 2018
